intro: Andryala pinnatifida subsp. preauxiana, commonly known as the Madagascar star-anise, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by star-shaped fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
